CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The polymer PDTP-DT2BT exhibits the highest PCE of 3.12% , ascribed to the largest J SC = 11.43 mA cm^-2 with a slightly lower V OC of 0.54 V and a slightly higher FF of 0.57 than the other polymers.

Let's think step by step.

1. PDTP-DT2BT: This is the name of the polymer.
2. PCE: It stands for Power Conversion Efficiency, which is a property or performance metric of the polymer.
3. J SC: It stands for Short Circuit Current Density, which is another performance metric of the polymer.
4. mA cm^-2: This is the unit of J SC.
5. V OC: It stands for Open Circuit Voltage, which is another performance metric of the polymer.
6. V: This is the unit of voltage.
7. FF: It stands for Fill Factor, which is another performance metric of the polymer.
8. 0.57: This is the value of the Fill Factor for the polymer PDTP-DT2BT.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.
1. PDTP-DT2BT: This is the name of the polymer.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The polymer PDTP-DT2BT exhibits the highest PCE of 3.12% , ascribed to the largest J SC = 11.43 mA cm^-2 with a slightly lower V OC of 0.54 V and a slightly higher FF of 0.57 than the other polymers.

Let's think step by step.

1. PDTP-DT2BT: This is the name of the specific polymer being discussed.
2. PCE: This stands for Power Conversion Efficiency.
3. J SC: This stands for Short-Circuit Current Density.
4. mA cm^-2: This is the unit of measurement for Short-Circuit Current Density.
5. cm^-2: This is the unit of measurement for area density or square centimeters.
6. V OC: This stands for Open-Circuit Voltage.
7. V: This is the unit of measurement for voltage.
8. FF: This stands for Fill Factor.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. PDTP-DT2BT: This is the name of the specific polymer.
2. PCE: Power Conversion Efficiency (Material Property)
3. J SC: Short-Circuit Current Density (Material Property)
4. V OC: Open-Circuit Voltage (Material Property)
5. FF: Fill Factor (Material Property)

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| --- |
| Power Conversion Efficiency (PCE) |
| Short-Circuit Current Density (J SC) |
| Open-Circuit Voltage (V OC) |
| Fill Factor (FF) |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The polymer PDTP-DT2BT exhibits the highest PCE of 3.12% , ascribed to the largest J SC = 11.43 mA cm^-2 with a slightly lower V OC of 0.54 V and a slightly higher FF of 0.57 than the other polymers.

Let's think step by step.

1. PDTP-DT2BT: This is the name of the polymer. It is not explicitly labeled as a property value entity, but it can be considered as a category or identifier for the following property values.
2. 3.12%: This is the highest Power Conversion Efficiency (PCE) of the PDTP-DT2BT polymer.
3. 11.43 mA cm^-2: This is the largest Short Circuit Current Density (J SC) of the PDTP-DT2BT polymer.
4. 0.54 V: This is the Voltage at Open Circuit (VOC) of the PDTP-DT2BT polymer.
5. 0.57: This is the Fill Factor (FF) of the PDTP-DT2BT polymer.

So, the property value entities in the paragraph are: PCE = 3.12%, J SC = 11.43 mA cm^-2, VOC = 0.54 V, and FF = 0.57.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

The following entities clearly refer to the values of material properties for the PDTP-DT2BT polymer:

1. 3.12%: Power Conversion Efficiency (PCE)
2. 11.43 mA cm^-2: Short Circuit Current Density (J SC)
3. 0.54 V: Voltage at Open Circuit (VOC)
4. 0.57: Fill Factor (FF)

These entities represent measurable values that describe the material properties of the PDTP-DT2BT polymer.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| --- |
| Power Conversion Efficiency (PCE) = 3.12% |
| Short Circuit Current Density (J SC) = 11.43 mA cm^-2 |
| Voltage at Open Circuit (VOC) = 0.54 V |
| Fill Factor (FF) = 0.57 |
